thread.title: Top-order takes Punjab to comfortable position
thread.title_full: Top-order takes Punjab to comfortable position

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Top-order takes Punjab to comfortable position
text:
Patiala, October 23
Punjab batted well to end Day Two at a comfortable 182/2 after bowling out Madhya Pradesh for 370 in their Ranji Trophy match here today. Openers Manan Vohra (32) and Jiwanjot Singh (66) looked in fine touch as they provided a decent start to the team. After Vohra was bowled by Jalaj Saxena, Uday Kaul (55no) raised a 106-run stand with Jiwanjot. The partnership ended when Ankit Sharma trapped Jiwanjot lbw. Mandeep Singh (22no) ensured that Punjab did not lose another wicket before the draw of stumps. Bandeep takes J&K to 428 Agartala: Bandeep Singh hit a fine half-century to help Jammu and Kashmir post an impressive 428 against Tripura here today. J&K then bowled well to reduce the hosts to 85/2 at the close of play. The visitors had started their innings at 303/4. They added 125 runs to their overnight total before being bowled out. Dogra leads HP’s charge Dharamsala: Paras Dogra struck an unbeaten hundred as Himachal Pradesh produced a steady batting performance to post 298/5 in reply to Goa's first innings total of 324 here today. Dogra's 139-run knock came off 175 balls and included 18 fours and three sixes. Bowlers give Haryana lead
Mysuru: If the opening day saw Virender Sehwag at his vintage best, the second day witnessed the domination of Haryana bowlers as the visitors packed Karnataka for 221 to grab a 110-run first innings lead in the Group A match here today. Starting at the overnight total of 319/8, Haryana folded up for 331. The Haryana bowlers, however, came out all guns blazing against the defending champions. Off-spinners Rahul Dagar (3/10) and Jayant Yadav (2/75) spun an excruciating web to bowl out the hosts for just 221. Building on their lead, Haryana were 27 for no loss at stumps. — Agencies Ranji Trophy
Madhya Pradesh: 370 all out (A Shrivastava 131, R Khan 66; S Ladda 5/110); Punjab 182 for 2 (Jiwanjot 66, U Kaul 55 no; A Sharma 1/61). Jammu & Kashmir: 428 all out (P Rasool 130, B Singh 63; A Sarkar 3/33, R Dutta 3/86); Tripura 85 for 2 Goa : 324; HP : 298/5 (P Dogra 139no, P Parmeswaran 3/49) Haryana 331 and 27/0; Karnataka 221 all out (Rahul 63, Gautam 45no; Dagar 3/10, Yadav 2/75).
